variant.question:
As the speed of an aircraft at 20,000ft increases
Parasite Drag:

options.text: Increases as the square of the TAS
Decreases at first, then increases
Increases at first, then decreases at Mcdr.
Decreases

variant.question: Speed brakes are devices used on large transport category aircraft:

options.text: to increase drag in order to maintain a steeper gradient of descent.
and are an old version of anti-block system.
for speed reduction during landing.
used at high speeds for turning when a yaw damper is not installed.

variant.question: Many aeroplanes are equipped with speed brakes. Speed brakes are usually made up of one or several panels:

options.text: Somewhere on the fuselage or wing which extends into the airstream to create a turbulent airflow and increase parasite drag.
Which extend into the airstream to create vortices that re-energise the boundary layer resulting in an increase in parasite drag.
That form part of the primary flight controls and deflect to generate more downash which in turn increases induced drag.
Which extend from the wings upper surface into the airstream to disrupt the laminar flow, reducing lift and increasing induced drag.

variant.question: The rate and depth of breathing is primarily controlled by the

options.text: amount of carbon dioxide in the blood.
amount of carbon monoxide in the blood.
amount of nitrogen in the blood.
total atmospheric pressure.

variant.question: During a steady glide, increasing descent angle will...

options.text: increase difference between lift and weight
increase lift
Increase drag
increase VS

variant.question: During a steady glide, increasing descent angle will:

options.text: Increase difference between lift and weight
Lift and weight will remain the same for the new angle of descent.
Decrease difference between lift and weight
Both lift and weight will increase

variant.question: What would happen to an aircraft's rate of descent and the angle of descent when deploying the speed brakes in flight?

options.text: Both the rate of descent and the descent angle will increase.
Both the rate of descent and the descent angle will decrease.
The rate of descent will increase and the descent angle will decrease.
The rate of descent will decrease and the descent angle will increase.
